docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a Ross Douthat column about the contrast between the burden of unwanted pregnancies and the burden of infertility.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a Ross Douthat column about the contrast between the burden of unwanted pregnancies and the burden of infertility.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE effort that goes into dressing a prize-winning red carpet clotheshorse often feels greater than what one can properly say about the ugly dress or indeed a second-rate event. Last week's People's Choice Awards illustrated the problem. After deploying references to Adderall, Xanax, ''Pride and Prejudice'' and fancy pillowcases to describe the awfulness of the clothes, Amy Odell of New York magazine's Cut blog received a lecture from readers about her misuse of Jane Austen. There are no milkmaids in ''Pride and Prejudice,'' she was told, certainly no ''slovenly milkmaids.'' Ms. Odell might wish she had just said cow.
docs.abstract: Cathy Horyn On The Runway column on stylists who dress celebrities for award shows; photo (S)
